newsitem.title: USA: NOTICE OF SALE - Penfield CSD, N.Y.
newsitem.headline: NOTICE OF SALE - Penfield CSD, N.Y.

text.p: SEALED PROPOSALS will be received and considered by the President of the Board of Education of Penfield Central School District, Monroe County, New York at the offices of Fleet Bank, Private Banking Department, Mezzanine Level, One East Avenue, Rochester, New York 14638, until 10:00 A.M., Prevailing Time, on at which time and place the bids will be opened, for the purchase IN FEDERAL FUNDS at not less than par and accrued interest of $1,800,000 School District (Serial) Bonds, 1996, (the "Bonds"), maturing on June 15 of each year as follows:
The Bonds will be dated December 15, 1996 and will bear interest payable semi annually on June 15 and December 15 of each year commencing June 15, 1997.

The Bonds will be awarded to the bidder offering to purchase the Bonds at such rate or rates of interest as will produce the lowest net interest cost in accordance with the terms set forth in the Notice of Sale.

The Bonds maturing on or after June 15, 2005 are subject to redemption at the option of the School District in accordance with the terms set forth in the Notice of Sale. The School District will designate the Bonds as "qualified tax-exempt obligations" pursuant to Section 265(b)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.

The Bonds will be issued by means of a book-entry-only system with The Depository Trust Company, New York, New York, which will act as securities depository for the Bonds. The School District will furnish the Bonds and the approving legal opinion of St. John & Curtin, Rochester, New York, on or about December 30, 1996.

The School District reserves the right to change the time and/or date for the opening of bids. Notice of any such change shall be provided not less than 24 hours prior to the time set forth above for the opening of bids by means of a supplemental notice of sale to be transmitted over The Munifacts Wire.
Requests for copies of the Notice of Sale he

summarized and the Official Statement relating to the Bonds and such other information as the State Comptroller may prescribe by rule or order may be directed to Bernard P. Donegan, Inc., PO Box 70, Victor, New York 14564; Phone
Penfield, New York President, Board of Education
